buildup.text: Most adults drink less water than their body needs. Coffee and soda don't fully compensate for the deficit.

discovery.text: Drinking water first thing in the morning kickstarts metabolism and rehydrates after hours of sleep.

twist.text: Thirst is a late signal. By the time you feel thirsty, your brain is already underperforming.

climax.text: Keep a water bottle visible all day. Visibility turns hydration from a decision into a default habit.

punchline.text: Drink water before you're thirsty. Your brain needs it now.

quiz.question: At what dehydration level does cognitive performance drop?
options: Just 1-2% dehydration reduces focus and mood
Dehydration has no effect on the brain
